board

Class NurbsBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • board.AbstractBoard
      • board.NurbsBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class NurbsBoard
extends AbstractBoard
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Defines the 3D model of the board. The 3D model consists of two nurbs surfaces, one for the deck and one for the bottom. These surfaces can be generated from the Bezier curves for the outline, rocker, and cross sections using either a smooth approximation using the method approximate_bezier, or a more exact approximation using create_bezier_patch. This class also provides methods for manipulating the surfaces directly. This is especially useful in order to create swallow tails that cannot be described directly by the 2D curves.

      Adds a surface segment at a given position
      void approximate_bezier(BezierBoard bezier_board, boolean closed_model)
      Creates a 3D model of the board by fitting a bspline surface This method selects a number of points from the 2D model that we want the 3D model to interpolate, and creates deck and bottom surfaces that fits those.

      Fits the outline and the rocker of the current 3D model to the bezier curves.

      void create_bottom(int segments, int nr_of_points, NurbsPoint[][] desired_points)
      Fits the bottom surface to a number of desired points This method uses and iterative algorithm [1] to fit a Bspline surface to a given ordered point set without solving a linear system.

      • create_deck

        public void create_deck(int segments,
               int nr_of_points,
               NurbsPoint[][] desired_points)
        Fits the deck surface to a number of desired points This method uses and iterative algorithm [1] to fit a Bspline surface to a given ordered point set without solving a linear system. It starts by creating an initial non-uniform B-spline surface which takes the given point setas its control point set. Then by adjusting its control points gradually with iterative formula, it produce a non-uniform B-spline surfaces with gradually highervprecision. [1] LIN Hongwei, WANG Guojin & DONG Chenshi, "Constructing iterative non-uniform B-spline curve and surface to fit data points", Science in China Ser. F Information Sciences, Vol.47 No.3 pp. 315-331, 2004
        Parameters:
        segments - - nr of segments in the surface
        nr_of_points - - nr of points in the surface
        desired_points - - the points to which we want to fit the surface

      • create_bottom

        public void create_bottom(int segments,
                 int nr_of_points,
                 NurbsPoint[][] desired_points)
        Fits the bottom surface to a number of desired points This method uses and iterative algorithm [1] to fit a Bspline surface to a given ordered point set without solving a linear system. It starts by creating an initial non-uniform B-spline surface which takes the given point setas its control point set. Then by adjusting its control points gradually with iterative formula, it produce a non-uniform B-spline surfaces with gradually highervprecision. [1] LIN Hongwei, WANG Guojin & DONG Chenshi, "Constructing iterative non-uniform B-spline curve and surface to fit data points", Science in China Ser. F Information Sciences, Vol.47 No.3 pp. 315-331, 2004
        Parameters:
        segments - - nr of segments in the surface
        nr_of_points - - nr of points in the surface
        desired_points - - the points to which we want to fit the surface

      • approximate_bezier

        public void approximate_bezier(BezierBoard bezier_board,
                      boolean closed_model)
        Creates a 3D model of the board by fitting a bspline surface This method selects a number of points from the 2D model that we want the 3D model to interpolate, and creates deck and bottom surfaces that fits those.
        Parameters:
        bezier_board - - the bezier model that we want to fit
        closed_model - - True if we want the surfaces to be closed in the nose and tail

      • approximate_bezier2

        public void approximate_bezier2(BezierBoard bezier_board)
        Fits the outline and the rocker of the current 3D model to the bezier curves.
        Parameters:
        bezier_board - - the bezier model that we want to fit

      • create_bezier_patch

        public int create_bezier_patch(BezierBoard bezier_board)
        Creates a 3D model of the boards by fitting Bezier patches to the 2D curves. This produces a surface that fits the 2D curves much closer than the approximated b-spline surfaces above. On the other hand the surfaces becomes less intuitive to edit compared to the bspline-surfaces.
        Parameters:
        bezier_board - - the bezier model that we want to fit
        Returns:
        int -1 if error
